article_title: Ally Financial Profit Drops as It Prepares to Exit TARP
article_text:
The top executive of Ally Financial Inc. said Thursday the company should be able to exit the U.S. government's crisis-era rescue program by year-end following recent moves to divest several businesses and improve relationships with banking regulators.

The Detroit-based company has streamlined its operations in recent years in an effort to overcome legal hurdles that had hindered its ability to fully repay the $17.2 billion it...

twitter.description: Ally Financial said fourth-quarter profit plunged after settling federal allegations of lending discrimination and taking several steps to exit the mortgage business. CEO Michael Carpenter expects Ally to exit the TARP program by the end of 2014.
twitter.title: Ally Financial Profit Drops as It Prepares to Exit TARP
